page.title: 01An introduction to the area
page.content: This rural area is largely "made up" of two villages; Tidbury Green and Earlswood.There are many farms_ meat,dairy and crop growing.Part of the Stratford on Avon canal runs through the area as does part of the Stratford to Birmingham(Moor St.) railway line,known as the Warwickshire line.A further feature of the area are the Earlswood Lakes which were built originally as a "feeder" for the Stratford Canal. Tidbury Green is a small village between Dickens Heath and Grimes Hill where four roads meet. It was first recorded in 1840.Historically it was all part of the Forest of Arden and there is evidence of this in that there are several areas of woodland remaining today.
